WorleyParsons ( WOR ) , a provider of services to the oil and gas sector , said it has won a new five year engineering , procurement and construction management contract in Turkey but its shares were dragged down by the mining sector .

The contract is for work on the 1,800 km Trans Anatolian Natural Gas Pipeline Project ( TANAP ) , which is designed to transport Caspian natural gas from the Georgian - Turkish border to Turkey 's western border with Greece .
WorleyParsons did n't reveal the value of the contract , although the overall project is worth $ 11.7bn .
